label: Description
value: A white tea caddy with a bulbous shoulder and simple cup-like lid. Tea caddy outlined in gilt with painted birds, flowers and figure on the sides.

label: Physical description
value: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam. (a,b: overall): 10.5 × 9 cm (4 1/8 × 3 9/16 in.) H x diam. (a: caddy): 9.5 × 9 cm (3 3/4 × 3 9/16 in.) H x diam. (b: lid): 1.5 × 3.5 cm (9/16 × 1 3/8 in.)

label: Provenance

label: Description
value: Pear-shaped, with painted spout, loop handle, on base ring. Decorated with large flowers and buds on leafy stems, surmounted by a border containing triangular latticed panels. Cover with knob in form of a flower on stem. Decorated with butterfly and floral spray in blue.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Vining floral design typical of Chinese hand painted wallpapers. In foreground, strange rock formation amid grassy plateaus, waterlillies in pond at right, two large predatory birds amidst smaller birds, hummingbird and butterflies. Painted in bright polychrome color.

label: Description
value: Vining floral design typical of Chinese handpainted wallpapers. Brightly colored birds and vines hand painted on silk.

label: Description
value: Miser's purse type, knitted in colored silks with ornamentation in bands showing conventionalized forms and spread eagles with crown and the words "S.D. Casparre Nicoletti." Partially lined in red silk.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk Technique: stranded knitting

label: Description
value: One of four fragments of cotton, copperplate printed in red design known as American Independence, Apotheosis of Franklin, etc.  the design shows Washington in a chariot drawn by leopards, standing and behind him a female figure holding a shield on which "American Independence 1776" is inscribed.  Franklin is shown with a female figure carrying a liberty cap on the staff; above them a scroll: "Where Liberty Dwells There is my Country."

value: Medium: linen warp, cotton weft Technique: copperplate printed on plain weave

Benjamin Franklin is shown with a female figure carrying a liberty cap on a staff; above them on a scroll: "Where Liberty Dwells There is my Country."

Traveling case with cup and saucer

label: Description
value: Cup with flaring rim, high loop handle terminating in a serpent's head, with high foot. Ornamented with trophies and initials "T.C." in raised floral wreath.  Foliate bands near rim and base of cup.  Saucer decorated with trophies and raised floral wreaths, one with inscription "Por la vida", the other with pair of blazing hearts.  At center of bowl, circular medallion with five-pointed star. Rectangular leather-covered case with hinged lid; circular metal ring at top and metal closures at front.  See also glass beaker, 1931-41-8.

label: Physical description
value: Stamped and dyed leather adhered to wood, cast brass (case); enameled, glazed and gilt porcelain, blown and engraved glass

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D (a, cup): 11.8 x 7.8 x 10 cm (4 5/8 x 3 1/16 x 3 15/16 in.) H x diam. (b, saucer): 3.2 x 13.4 cm (1 1/4 x 5 1/4 in.) H x W x D (c, box closed): 15.7 x 20 x 15.2 cm (6 3/16 x 7 7/8 x 6 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Beaker with flaring rim. Heavy channeled base surmounted by a facetted diamond-patterned band. On one side, engraved shield with letter C, floral sprays. On opposite side, a cherub drawn by two flying birds. Engraved rim with alternating group of 5 circular rounds and horizontal lozenge shape.  See also 1931-41-7-a/c.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Tan satin ground with some details of the design in plain weave. Allover closely-spaced design of curving branches with large decorative flowers and foliage. Peacocks perch on branches. Design in the tan functional weft and an extra coral silk weft.

label: Description
value: White satin ground brocaded with symmetrical design in gold, and green, coral and pink silk. Large, central fan-shaped ornamental motif with cornucopia and a bow. Backed with red silk and edged with gold metal lace.

label: Description

value: Painted, stencilled and gilded maple wood, caning

value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: White silk letter case, worked as a single panel and folded. Embroidered in silver threads with scenes of animals and flowers, with swagged garlands.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and silver foil-wrapped silk embroidery on silk foundation Technique: embroidered in chain, stem and satin stitches on plain weave foundation Technique detail: embroidery on white silk plain weave; chain, stem and satin stitches using dyed silks; chain stitch using silver foil-wrapped silk; worked as a single panel, folded

label: Description
value: Single piece of silver bent to form tongs with spoon-form grips, bright-cut on back with oval patera and guilloche bands, the patera with engraved intials "HMJ" script in center.

label: Description
value: Letter case of green silk damask with conventionalized design in metallic thread;  lining of white silk.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: metal-wrapped silk threads, flat gilt wire and silver spangles on silk foundation Technique: embroidered in padded couching stitches on damask foundation

label: Description
value: Silver cloth cover ornamented with vine borders worked in metal thread embroidery with spangles. Monogram C.F. on one side, heart with torches on the other.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: metal thread embroidery on metal foundation, spangles Technique: embroidered Technique detail: embellished white silk plain weave faced with silver foil-wrapped silk; attached paste jewels; red, blue and green glazed foil spangles; coils of gilt and silver wire; worked as a single panel, folded

value: Cover of silk and metal thread in tapestry weave, depicting a landscape and animals; paper lining.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk Technique: plain weave with discontinuous weft (tapestry)

label: Description
value: Panel  in the ‘bizarre’ style made of four widths of silk satin, originally white. Alternating horizontal rows of repeating motifs show a church built on rocks with tall sheltering trees, and disproportionately large pink flowers  and buds with leaves. Backed with silk and linen. Two short ends trimmed with coral and yellow silk fringe.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: compound weave with supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1931: Hewitt collection; 1931: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Off-white cotton sheer ground with embroidered design of a stylized floral spray with two large blossoms and numerous small ones curving to the left.  The vines are executed in gold foil strips, the small flowers in gilt sequins, and the leaves in beetle elytra.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton ground, beetle elytra, gold foil strips, gilt sequins, gold metal-wrapped silk thread Technique: plain weave embroidered with cut beetle wings and sequins

label: Description
value: Bulbous circular body with narrow neck and circular foot. Nickle lid and rim. Molded relief decoration of grapes, volute scrolls and satyr masks. Half figure on handle. Light blue glaze.

value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Ridged stick with original leather strap and brown tassel. Mounting decorated with bands of geometric and floral ornament. Short brass ferule tipped with iron.
